p: The simple ointment was prepared according to the formula elaborated in the British Pharmacopoeia. 25 Firstly, hard paraffin (0.50 g) was melted in a water bath. Then all ingredients of the ointment base (cetostearyl alcohol (0.50 g), white soft paraffin (8.5 g), and wool fat (0.50 g)) were added into melted hard paraffin in descending order of melting point and heated gently, with stirring until homogenous. Then the mixture was allowed to cool while stirring. Then 10 g and 20 g of the crude extract were integrated into the simple ointment base to formulate the crude extract into 5% and 10% (w/w) extract ointments, by using levigation.
